item.title: 新堡垒能源公司因各业务部门表现疲软而出现季度亏损
item.description: 美国液化天然气公司新堡垒能源（New Fortress Energy）周三公布第一季度业绩亏损，受船舶、码头和基础设施两部分业绩疲软的影响，该公司股价在盘后交易中下跌近19%。【原文：U.S. LNG firm New Fortress Energy posted a loss in the first quarter on Wednesday, hurt by weak performance across both its segments of ships, and terminals and infrastructure, sending the shares down nearly 19% in extended trading.】

item.title: 人工智能驱动需求，思科上调全年业绩预期；股价上涨
item.description: 思科系统公司（Cisco Systems）周三上调了年度业绩预期，押注在人工智能热潮的推动下，云计算客户对其网络设备的需求将保持稳定。【原文：Cisco Systems raised its annual results forecast on Wednesday, betting on steady demand from cloud customers for its networking equipment, driven by the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 英伟达支持的 CoreWeave 第一季度营收超出预期
item.description: CoreWeave 周三发布了其作为上市公司的首份财报，季度营收超出华尔街预期，这表明市场对这家由英伟达（Nvidia）支持的人工智能云计算初创公司的服务需求强劲。【原文：CoreWeave on Wednesday beat Wall Street estimate for quarterly revenue in its first set of results as a public company, signaling strength in demand for the Nvidia-backed AI cloud computing startup's services.】

item.title: Uber 和 iFood 宣布在巴西建立战略合作伙伴关系
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc）和巴西送餐应用 iFood 周三宣布在巴西建立战略合作伙伴关系。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc and iFood, a Brazilian food delivery app, on Wednesday announced a strategic partnership in Brazil, where delivery and ride-hailing services have grown rapidly in recent years.】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司预计 F-35 获奖时间早于预期
item.description: 美国国防承包商洛克希德-马丁公司的财务主管周三表示，该公司预计将比之前预计的更快获得F-35喷气式战斗机的最终合同。【原文：Lockheed Martin expects to be awarded a finalized contract on its F-35 jets, which have been beset by delays in a technology upgrade, sooner than it previously anticipated, the U.S. defense contractor's finance chief said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Aeva 出售 6% 股份并达成生产协议，股价上涨
item.description: Aeva Technologies 是一家由苹果公司前工程师创办的公司，主要生产用于工厂和自动驾驶汽车的传感器。该公司周三表示，已将 6% 的股份以 5000 万美元的价格出售给了一家未具名的战略合作伙伴，该合作伙伴未来还将负责公司的部分生产业务。【原文：Aeva Technologies , a firm founded by former Apple engineers that makes sensors used in factories and self-driving vehicles, on Wednesday said it had sold a 6% stake for $50 million to an unnamed strategic partner that will also handle some of its manufacturing in the future.】

item.title: Netflix 称广告支持服务拥有 9,400 万用户
item.description: Netflix 宣布，目前其广告支持层的订户已从 11 月的 7000 万增至 9400 万。【原文：Netflix announced it now has 94 million subscribers to its advertising-supported tier, up from 70 million in November.】

item.title: 伍德麦肯兹认为未来 15 年满足天然气发电需求面临挑战
item.description: 能源研究公司伍德麦肯兹（Wood Mackenzie）周三在一份报告中说，由于制造限制、成本上升和可再生能源的竞争，燃气轮机市场在未来 15 年可能难以满足强劲的需求。【原文：The gas turbine market might have trouble satisfying strong demand in the next 15 years due to manufacturing constraints, rising costs and competition from renewables, energy research firm Wood Mackenzie said in a report on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，微软Office-Teams报价很可能避免欧盟反垄断罚款
item.description: 三位熟悉此事的人士周三表示，由于欧盟监管机构可能会接受微软对其 Office 和 Teams 产品提出的收购要约，微软将避免被处以巨额反垄断罚款。【原文：Microsoft is set to stave off a possible hefty antitrust fine as EU regulators are likely to accept an offer on its Office and Teams products, three people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, amid tensions with the United States over the EU's scrutiny of Big Tech.】

item.title: 零售商敦促欧盟委员会打击威士卡和万事达卡
item.description: 欧洲最大的零售商和在线零售巨头敦促欧盟委员会控制威士卡和万事达卡涉嫌收取的高额费用，称其损害了集团的竞争力并妨碍了竞争对手。【原文：Europe's largest retailers and online retail giants have urged the European Commission to rein in allegedly high fees charged by Visa and Mastercard , saying they hurt the bloc's competitiveness and hamper rivals.】

item.title: 美国 FDA 批准艾伯维治疗一种肺癌的药物
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局已批准艾伯维公司的药物用于治疗一种曾接受过治疗的成人肺癌患者。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved AbbVie's drug to treat adults with a type of lung cancer who have received previous treatment, the drugmaker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 沃尔玛如何应对特朗普的关税，为零售业健康发展提供线索
item.description: 作为美国零售业的风向标，沃尔玛的业绩将在本周四证明，为什么阿肯色州的这个庞然大物最有能力应对特朗普政府关税带来的不确定性。【原文：Results from Walmart , a bellwether for the U.S. retail industry, will offer proof on Thursday why the Arkansas behemoth is best placed to navigate the uncertainty from the Trump administration's tariffs.】

item.title: 纽约起诉 Capital One 欺骗储蓄储户
item.description: Capital One 周三遭到纽约州总检察长莱蒂西亚-詹姆斯（Letitia James）的起诉，她指控该银行以其旗舰产品 "高息 "储蓄账户欺骗储户，使其损失了数百万美元的利息。【原文：Capital One was sued on Wednesday by New York Attorney General Letitia James, who accused the bank of cheating depositors with its flagship "high interest" savings accounts out of millions of dollars in interest.】

item.title: 独家报道法律初创公司哈维人工智能（Harvey AI）正在洽谈估值 50 亿美元的融资事宜
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，哈维人工智能公司（Harvey AI）是一家快速发展的法律初创公司，该公司正在就新一轮融资进行深入谈判，融资额将超过 2.5 亿美元，估值达 50 亿美元。【原文：Harvey AI, a fast-growing legal startup, is in advanced talks to raise over $250 million in a new round of funding at a valuation of $5 billion, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 法国赛诺菲公司计划在美国投资至少 200 亿美元
item.description: 赛诺菲（Sanofi）周三表示，公司计划投资至少200亿美元，在2030年前加强在美国的生产和研究，成为为应对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的贸易政策而扩大在美业务规模的最新一家制药商。【原文：Sanofi said on Wednesday it plans to invest at least $20 billion to boost manufacturing and research in the United States through 2030, becoming the latest drugmaker to scale up its U.S. presence in response to President Donald Trump's trade policies.】

item.title: Perplexity与PayPal合作为用户提供便捷的支付结账服务
item.description: Perplexity AI 周三表示，它已与支付公司贝宝（PayPal）合作，在其聊天界面上实现直接购买。【原文：Perplexity AI said on Wednesday it had partnered with payments firm PayPal to enable direct purchases within its chat interface.】

item.title: 谷歌称黑客曾以英国零售业为目标，现在又以美国零售商为目标
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司表示，曾以英国零售业为目标的黑客现在把注意力转向了美国零售商。【原文：Alphabet's Google says that the hackers who have targeted the UK retail sector are now turning their attention to American retailers.】

item.title: 贝恩下调销售预期，奢侈品行业前景更加黯淡
item.description: 贝恩咨询公司（Bain & Co）周二预测，今年全球奢侈品销售额可能下降2%至5%，大幅下调了此前预计的0%至4%的增长率，预示着继2024年下降1%之后，奢侈品行业的前景将更加暗淡。【原文：Sales of luxury goods worldwide are likely to fall between 2% and 5% this year, consultancy Bain & Co forecast on Tuesday, sharply downgrading its previous estimate for 0-4% growth and signalling further gloom for the sector after 2024's 1% drop.】

item.title: 美国将废除降低联邦土地上太阳能和风能项目费用的规定
item.description: 特朗普政府采取措施废除了拜登时代降低联邦土地上可再生能源项目费用的规定，称该规定不公平地偏袒了风能和太阳能设施的开发。【原文：The Trump administration took steps to rescind a Biden-era regulation that lowered fees for renewable energy projects on federal lands, saying the rule unfairly favored development of wind and solar facilities.】

item.title: 汇丰银行将在法国裁员 10
item.description: 汇丰银行周三表示，该行计划通过自愿裁员计划在法国裁减 348 个职位，约占其在法国员工总数的 10%。【原文：HSBC plans to cut 348 jobs in France through a voluntary redundancy scheme, amounting to about 10% of its workforce in the country, the bank said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，凯雷接近达成出售意大利高端品牌 Twinset 的交易
item.description: 周三，两位接近此事的消息人士称，美国私募股权集团凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）有望在未来几天内达成一项协议，将意大利时装品牌 Twinset 出售给当地投资公司 Borletti Group 和 Quadrivio。【原文：U.S. private equity group Carlyle Group is expected to clinch in the coming days an accord to sell Italian fashion brand Twinset to local investment firms Borletti Group and Quadrivio, two sources close to the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 广告技术平台 MNTN 在美国 IPO 的目标估值高达 12.4 亿美元
item.description: 由瑞安-雷诺兹（Ryan Reynolds）担任首席创意官的广告技术平台 MNTN 周三表示，其美国首次公开募股的目标估值最高可达 12.4 亿美元。【原文：MNTN, an adtech platform that has Ryan Reynolds as its chief creative officer, said on Wednesday it was aiming for a valuation of up to $1.24 billion in its U.S. initial public offering.】

item.title: 法国育碧全年净预订额下降 20.5%
item.description: 法国最大的视频游戏制造商育碧公司（Ubisoft）周三公布，该公司全年净预订额下降了 20.5%，原因是该公司面临着延期发行和一些主要游戏表现不佳的问题。【原文：France's largest video game maker Ubisoft on Wednesday posted a 20.5% fall in full-year net bookings as the company has faced issues with delayed releases and the underperformance of some of its leading titles.】

item.title: 沙特阿美与美国公司签署价值高达 900 亿美元的交易
item.description: 沙特石油巨头沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）周三表示，该公司已与美国主要公司签署了 34 项协议，潜在价值高达 900 亿美元。【原文：Saudi Aramco has signed 34 agreements with major U.S. companies, potentially worth as much as $90 billion, the oil giant said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴黎人被誉为帮助挫败加密货币绑架案的英雄
item.description: 一名巴黎店主用灭火器冲向袭击者，帮助阻止了一伙蒙面人绑架一名法国加密货币商人的女儿，被誉为英雄。【原文：A Parisian shop-owner who helped prevent a masked gang from kidnapping the daughter of a French crypto businessman has been hailed as a hero after he rushed at the attackers with a fire extinguisher.】

item.title: 印度旅游公司报告土耳其预订量因巴基斯坦的支持而下降
item.description: 两家订票公司称，在土耳其和阿塞拜疆最近与新德里发生冲突期间支持巴基斯坦之后，印度人正在取消在这两个国家热门度假胜地的假期。【原文：Indians are cancelling holidays in popular resorts in Turkey and Azerbaijan after the countries supported Pakistan during its recent conflict with New Delhi, two booking firms said.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会委员将加入区块链协会并担任首席执行官
item.description: 区块链协会（Blockchain Association）周三表示，现任商品期货交易委员会（Commodity Futures Trading Commission）委员夏默-梅辛格（Summer Mersinger）将于6月加入该行业组织，担任首席执行官，因为加密货币行业正在加紧推动数字资产政策的全面改革。【原文：The Blockchain Association said on Wednesday that current Commodity Futures Trading Commission Commissioner Summer Mersinger will join the trade group as CEO in June, as the cryptocurrency sector ramps up its push to overhaul digital asset policy.】

item.title: 优步（Uber）通过共享固定路线乘车服务和扩大通行证范围，提高人们的经济承受能力
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）周三发布了一系列新产品，如共享固定路线乘车服务和扩展会员通行证，目标客户是寻求经济高效的出行方式的消费者。【原文：Uber Technologies on Wednesday unveiled a range of new offerings such as shared fixed-route rides and expanded membership passes, targeting consumers seeking cost-effective ways to travel.】

item.title: 欧盟准备在美国贸易谈判中采取 "缓兵之计 "以达成更大协议
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）本周表示，瑞士和英国已跃居与美国达成贸易协议的前列，他同时警告欧盟，欧盟的行动 "要慢得多"。布鲁塞尔表示并不过分担心。【原文：When U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week said Switzerland and Britain had jumped to the front of the queue for a trade deal with the United States, he warned the European Union it was moving "much slower". Brussels says it is not overly worried.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟探索频道重塑 HBO Max 品牌，向全球推广
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）正在对 Max 的品牌进行倒带，将两年前从流媒体服务中撤下的 HBO 名字重新拿回来。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery is hitting rewind on Max's branding, bringing back the HBO name it dropped from the streaming service two years ago.】
